Added command, parser, task list and ui file. Modify storage file.

* Command have 6 subclasses to run the task.
* Parser deals  with the command given by user.
* TaskList is an array list of task.
* Ui deals with user interface.
* Storage help to store and load the user list.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-9'
commitResults.messageBody:
Merge the find command to search for tasks by keyword

Currently the application doesn't have feature to find the task.

Users need a feature to filter out the tasks based on the keywords to
improve task management.

Implemnt a find feature that allows user to search for tasks by a
keyword.

The find feature is implemented as a new command and test with unit test
case to ensure it flows correctly.

The feature includes JUnit test cases to verify its functionality.

commitResults.messageTitle: Debug the missing import for FindCommand in Parser
commitResults.messageBody:
The Parser class fails to recognize the newly implemented FindCommand,
leading to erros when users try to execute the find command.

Without importing the FindCommand, the Parser cannot correctly process
the find command, resulting in a non-functional feature.

Add the import statement for FindCommand in the Parser class, ensuring
that the command is correctly executed.

Add the import resolves the issue without altering the existing command
structure, ensure the command run correctly.

After import, the functionailty is tested to confirm that the find
command works as expected.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-A-CodingStandard'
commitResults.messageBody: Merge bracnch-A-CodingStandard to the master branch

commitResults.messageTitle: Enforce coding style with checkstyle
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the codebase lacks consistent enforcemnt of coding style
guide, leading to potential readability and maintenance issues.

This commit integrates checkstyle to automatically detect and enforce
coding style violation.

Configure checkstyle with rules that align with this project's coding
standards. Run checkstyle on the existing codebase and fix identified
issues

This approach ensures consistency, improves readability and maintains
coding standards throughout the project.

Fix all the files with violation to coding standards.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-A-CheckStyle' Merge checkstyle integration into master branch
commitResults.messageBody:
Integrates CheckStyle into the project to enforce consistent coding
standard.This merge ensure all code in the master branch adheres to the
specified guidelines, improving the code readability and mainainability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Setup for JavaFX
Construct basic GUI
Modify the GUI by implementing the CSS files
Wrap up the GUI files into one package and modify the CSS of main window
Complete the feature of GUI
Modify some of the javaDoc to adhere the coding standard
Modify the parser to identify blankspace
JavaDoc for Launcher class
Merge branch 'branch-Level-10' Merge GUI updates and JavaFx
commitResults.messageBody:
The GUI integration with JavaFx is incomplete, leading to inconsistent
user behavior. JavaDoc annotation are incomplete across several classes,
cause documentation gaps. Additionally, the parser incorrectly handles
commands that end with a space, resulting in unexpected errors.

A fully integrated GUI is crucial for ensuring a smooth user experience.
Complete and accurate JavaDoc is essential for ongoing maintenance and
understanding codebase. Proper handling of trailing spaces in parser
inputs is necessary to prevent runtime exception and improve command
processing reliability.

Merge all recent GUI enhancements into master branch. Update and
complete JavaDoc annotations for better clarity and compliance. Modify
the parser to trim trailing spaces from commands before processing.

Merging GUI updates enhances feature coherence and stability. Updating
JavaDoc ensures compliance with coding standards and improves code
usability for future development. Triming spaces in the parser avoid
unnecessary errors and align with best practices for input violation.

Documentation has been reviewed to ensure most major methods and classes
are covered.

commitResults.messageTitle: Debug on exit handling for JavaFX
commitResults.messageBody:
The application does not correctly close when the "bye" command is
issued in the JavaFX GUI.

The improper shutdown handling can leave the JavaFX runtime hanging,
leading to potential resource management issue and a poor user
experience.

Use Platfrom.exit() in the ExitCommand class to properly terminate the
JavaFX application.

Platform.exit() allows for a graceful shutdown of the JavaFX platform.

This changes provide a reliable and user-friendly way to exit the
applicaiton, avoiding abrupt terminations.

commitResults.messageTitle: Clean up storage for future debug on list command
commitResults.messageBody:
The list command returns "Here is your list" even when the list is
empty.

The behaviour is incorrect, as no list should be displayed when it is
empty.

Clean up storage to prepare for debugging and  fixing this issue.

Proper storage cleanup is needed to accurately reflect list data and
resolve the false output.

Future debugging will focus on identifying the source of the incorrect
list ouput.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug in list command output when list is empty
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, the list command would incorrectly return "Here is your
list:" even when there were no items.

This behaviour was misleading, as no list should be displayed when the
list is empty.

Update the output to return "There is nothing in your list!" when the
list is empty.

This ensures the output is accurate and reflects the correct state of
the list.

The bug is now fixed and will no longer show a misleading message when
the list is empty.

commitResults.messageTitle: Assertions are missing in several classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Without proper assertions, crticial assumptions about input validity are
not enforced, which could lead to errors or unexpected behaviour,
especially when interacting with user input, storage and tasks.

Add assertions across classes to validate inputs and enforce
assumptions. Ensure inputs are not null and valid.

Assertions provide a low overhead way to validate critical conditions
during development and testing. They allow the program to fail fast and
early if unexpected situations arise, making debugging and issue
tracking more efficient.

JUnit tests are also updated to check for assertion failures using
assertionThrows for cases where invalid input is provided, ensuring the
code behaves as expected during development.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge pull request #1 from Fui03/branch-A-Assertions
commitResults.messageBody: Assertions are missing in several classes

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Storage class to improve code readability and maintainability
commitResults.messageBody:
The Storage class handles file operations, including loading saving and
appending tasks. The method is long and nested.

The date format and task status reduce code readabilty, making it harder
to maintain and extend in future. Magic strings can lead to mistakes and
incosistencies when handling tasks.

Introduce constants for task status and date format. Refactor task
parsing into sperate helper methods for each task type to improve
clarity and seperation of concerns.

Using constants improve readability and reduces the chance of errors
caused by magic strings. Seperating task parsing logic into individual
methods makes the code easier to follow, debug and extends in future.

These changes prepare the code for future enhancement while ensuring
that existing functionality is preserved and easier to manage.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Parser class and debug Find command output
commitResults.messageBody:
The Parser class contains duplicated logic for handling various
commands. Additionally, the FindCommand is not returning the correct
output when searching for tasks based on keywords.

The duplicated logic increase code complexity and reduces
maintainability, while the bug in the FindCommand affects the program's
functionality, leading to incorrect search results.

Refactor the Parser class to extract repeated logic into helper methods
for better readability and maintainability. Debug and fix the issue in
the FindCommand to ensure it returns the correct tasks when searching by
keywords.

Extracting repeated logic reduces duplication, simplifies the code
structure and makes future maintainence easier. Fixing the FindCommand
ensures the search functionality works as intended, improving overall
user experience.

The focus is on improving code quality.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Lama and Ui classes to improve code structure
commitResults.messageBody:
The Lama and Ui classes contain repetitive logic, have methods that are
doing more than one task, and are missing some seperation of concerns.
Additionally, exception handling in the Lama class is mixed with the
initialization logic, reducing readability and maintainability.

To improve code readability and maintainability, it is necessary to
reduce methode size, seperate concerns and handle exception in a
cleaner, more modular way. Repetitive code and mixed responsibilities
make it harder to manage in future changes or debug issues.

Refactor the Lama and Ui classes by:
* Extracting task list initialization into a seperate method in Lama
  class.
* Extracting the command processing loop into a helper method in Lama
  class.
* Reducing duplication in Ui by creating helper methods for printing
  bars and task lists.

Extracting logic into helper methods to improve readability by making
each method smaller and more focused.

The changes are localized to Lama and Ui classes, preserving existing
functionality while improving code structure and quality.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Deadline class by extracting date formats into constants
commitResults.messageBody:
The Deadline class contains hardcoded date format for displaying and
saving deadlines, which makes the code less maintainable.

Hardcoded date format make the code harded to modify and maintain.
Extracting them into constants improves readability and fexibility.

Extract the date formats into constants.

Using constants for date formats ensures that any future changes be made
in one place, improving maintainability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor DeleteCommand, FindCommand and ListCommand classes
commitResults.messageBody:
The DeleteCommand, FindCommand and ListCommand classes contain repeared
logic and could benefit from improved readability and seperation of
concerns.

Refactoring these commands will simplify the methods, improve error
handling and enhance readability by breaking down logic into smaller
helper methods.

Refactor classes by:
* Refactor DeleteCommand to extract output generation logic into helper
  method, improving readability and error handling.
* Refactor FindCommand to simplify the task-matching logic.
* Refactor ListCommand by creating a helper method for building task
  list output.

Breaking logic into helper methods making each method more focused.

These changes maintain the same functionality but improve the code
quality.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Main class structure and error handling
commitResults.messageBody:
The Main Class in the JavaFx application directly handles FXML loading
and scene setup in the start() method, which reduces the clarity and
maintainability. Exception handling is minimal, using only
e.printStackTrace() for IOException.

To improve readability, maintainability and error handling, the code
should seperate concerns by using helper methods and provide more
informative error message when issues arise.

Improve the class by extracting FXML loading and controller setup
logic into a helper method loadMainWindow().

These changes improve the seperation of concerns and make the Main class
easier to understand and maintain.

The core functionality remains unchanged, but refactoring improves code
clarity and maintainability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Ui class by extracting common logic
commitResults.messageBody:
The Ui class contains some repetitive code for displaying tasks leading
to redudancy in mulitple methods.

Code duplication makes maintenance more difficult and increases the
chances of incosistentcies.

Extract the common logic for displaying task lists into the
showTaskList() method and add showTaskCount() to handle repeated task
count display logic.

By centralizing repetitive code in helper methods, the class becomes
more readable and maintainable.

The core functionality remains unchanged.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/Fui03/ip into branch-A-CodeQuality
commitResults.messageBody:
Merge master to the branch-A-CodeQuality and resolve merge conflict

The current branch has been merged with the master branch, which
introduced the assertions and changes. A conflict occurred in the
data/lama.txt file, which stores the task data.

The conflict in data/lama.txt needs to be resolved to ensure proper data
storage and consistency between both branches. Without resolving this,
the application may not handle data properly.

Resolve the conflict in data/lama.txt by integrating the necessary
changes from both branches to ensure the data is stored correctly.

This ensures that the task data is managed correctly and both the
assertions from the master branch and changes from the current branch
are integrated without losing important functionality.

All conflicts have been resolved and the data file is now consistent
with both branches. Besides a checkstyle is runned and resolve the
coding style which not align with the requirement.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge pull request #2 from Fui03/branch-A-CodeQuality
commitResults.messageBody: Merge the branch-A-CodeQuality into master

commitResults.messageTitle: Add alias functionality to commands
commitResults.messageBody:
The application currently suports a fixed commands that requires users
to type out full command each time. There is no built-in functionality
for customising or shortening commands with user-defined aliases.

Allowing users to create aliases will improve the user experience by
enabling quicker and more flexible command entry. This will especially
benefit users who frequently use long commands.

Introduce a feature to allow users to set custom aliases for existing
commands. Add the AliasManager to handle alias storage and retrieval.
Implement new commands to manage aliases. Update parser to resolve
aliases.

By using an AliasManager, we centralize alias handling, making it easier
to maintain. The introduction of seperate commands for alias management
ensures clear and isolated functionality. Stroign aliases allows
persistence across sessions ,improving usability.

Default aliases like 't' for 'todo' are provided to streamline common
operations. Users can override these default as needed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Junit tests, modify the naming and handle empty input
commitResults.messageBody:
The application has alias functionality but lacks proper JUnit test
coverage to ensure its reliability. Additionally, there is no proper
handling for empty input.

Without JUnit tests, there is no automated way to verify that alias
commands behave correctly, potentially introducing bugs.

Modify the classes by:
* Added JUnit test cases for AliasCommand, DeleteAliasCommand and
  AliasManger to validate alias creation and deletion.
* Rename the deletealias to remove.
* Rename the command to aliases.
* Handle empty and invalid inputs.

Adding test cases ensure that alias-related feature are verified for
correctness. Renaming the command make it easier for user to understand
while input validation safeguards the system against potential misuse.

These improvements enhance the robustness, usability and maintainability
of the alias system.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Parser to resolve command after splitting the input
commitResults.messageBody:
The Parser class resolves the command using AliasManager before
splitting.

Resolving the command after splitting the input ensures that the command
is processed correctly and avoids unecessary repetition.

Refactor the code to split the input into words first and then resolve
command using AliasManager.

By splitting the input first, we gurantee that the AliasManager
processes the command correctly.

This change is a minor change focuses on improving the efficiency in the
command parsing logic.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-C-FriendlierSyntax' Merge aliases into master
commitResults.messageBody:
The aliases feature has been developed in a seperate branch and is ready
to be merged into the master branch. This feature allows users to define
custom aliases for commands, improving the user experience by making
command input more flexible.

To bring the alias functionality into the main application, we need to
merge the branch into master. This will make the new alias capabilities
available in the production codebase and ensure future development
builds upon the latest code.

Merge the branch into master branch, resolving any conflicts and
ensuring the feature integrates smoothly with the existing code.

Merging this feature ensures that the new functionality is properly
integrated and tested within the branch. Merging into master allows
lastes features to be included.

All alias-related feature and tests have been implemented and validated
in the branch. The merge ensure all aliases are fully functional.

commitResults.messageTitle: Align code with coding standards
commitResults.messageBody:
The codebase does not currently follow the project's established coding
standards, leading to incosistencies in code style and readability.

Enforce consitent formatting by applying the project's coding standards
to all files.

This is done to improve readability, maintainability and to adhere to
best practices.

No functional changes have been made.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add title and icon to JavaFX application
commitResults.messageBody:
The application currently launches with the default window title and no
custom icon which affects the overall user experience.

Set a custom title for the application window and add an icon to improve
visual presentation and enhance the application.

This change is done to make the app more identifiable and polished from
the user's perspective.

No other functionality is impacted by this update.

This needs to change to ensure a reasonable data is being output for the
